ar.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
ar.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

ca.commentary: Creat humorosament com a la "nimisin final" - qualsevol nova paraula semànticament estaria inclosa en "alente", així que se la pot descartar com a "alente però ocupant un nínxol encara més petit".
ca.definition: el conjunt de conceptes expressats per paraules establertes en toki pona, restat al conjunt de tots els conceptes existents, de tal manera que qualsevol concepte no expressat per una paraula existent en toki pona és expressat amb aquesta paraula

ceb_l.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
ceb_l.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

cs.commentary: Vytvořeno humorně jako "poslení nimisin" - každé novější slovo by sémanticky bylo zahrnuto v alente, takže může být vyvráceno za to, že je "alente, ale ještě podrobnější".
cs.definition: množina pojmů vyjádřena existujícími toki pona slovy odečtena od množiny všech možných pojmů takovým způsobem, že každý pojem, který ještě není vyjádřen existujícím toki pona slovem, je vyjádřen

cy.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
cy.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

da.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
da.definition: mængden af alle mulige menneskelige begreber fratrukket mængden af begreber, der allerede er dækket af etablerede toki pona-ord, vægtet efter deres relative brug

de.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
de.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

el.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
el.definition: Το σύνολο κάθε πιθανής ανθρώπινης έννοιας που αφαιρείται από το σύνολο των εννοιών που ήδη καλύπτονται από καθιερωμένες λέξεις toki pona σταθμισμένες με τη σχετική χρήση τους

en.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
en.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

eo.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
eo.definition: ĉiuj homaj konceptoj, subrahita de ĉiuj konceptoj ke oni povas priskribi per Tokiponaj vortoj, ordigita per relativa uzado

es.commentary: Creado de broma como el "nimisin final" - cualquier palabra nueva después ya está incluido semánticamente en "alente", entonces puede ser rechazado por ser "alente pero más específico".
es.definition: el grupo conformado por la suma de todos los conceptos imaginables, excepto los cuales ya están conceptualizados en la lista establecida de palabras en Toki Pona ordenadas según su frecuencia relativa de uso

fa.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
fa.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

fi.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

fr.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
fr.definition: ensemble des concepts exprimés par les mots toki pona établis soustrait de l'ensemble des concepts possibles, de telle sorte que chaque concept n'étant pas encore exprimé par un mot toki pona existant soit exprimé

haw.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
haw.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

he.commentary: הוטבעה בתור בדיחה כ"nimisin האחרונה" - כל מילה חדשה תוכל להיכלל באופן סמנטי בתוך alente, כדי שיהיה אפשר להפריך אותה בתור "alente אבל יותר ספיציפית".
he.definition: הקבוצה של כל רעיון אנושי אפשרי פחות הקבוצה של רעיונות שמכוסים של ידי מילות טוקי פונה מבוססות, משוקללות לפי השימוש היחסי שלהן

hi.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

ja.definition: 相対的使用率によって重みづけした既存のトキポナ単語で表現できる概念全体から漏れた、人間のもつあらゆる概念の集合

lou.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

mi.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
mi.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

nb.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
nb.definition: mengden av alle mulige menneskelige konsepter subtrahert av mengden av konsepter som allerede er omfattet av etablerte toki pona-ord vektlagt etter sin relative bruk

nl.commentary: Men noemde het "de laatste nimisin" - elk volgend woord zou semantisch gezien een deel van "alente" uitmaken, dus zouden de volgende woorden overbodig zijn, want ze zijn gewoon "alente, maar dan nog specifieker".
nl.definition: De set van elk mogelijk menselijk consept, afgetrokken van de set van consepten die al bedekt worden door bestaande toki pona woorden in verhouding van hun relatief gebruik

nn.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
nn.definition: mengden av alle moglege menneskelege konsept subtrahert av mengden av konsept som allereie er omfatta av etablerte toki pona-ord vekta etter sin relative bruk

pa.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
pa.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

pl.commentary: Wymyślone dowcipnie jako „ostateczny nimisin” - znaczenie jakiegokolwiek nowszego słowa byłoby zawarte w alente, więc możnaby je odrzucić za bycie „alente, ale jeszcze bardziej niszowym”.
pl.definition: zbiór pojęć wyrażanych przez przyjęte słowa tokipońskie odjęty od zbioru wszystkich możliwych pojęć, tak, że wyrażone są wszystkie pojęcia nie wyrażane dotąd przez istniejące słowa tokipońskie

pt.commentary: Cunhado humorosamente como o "nimisin final" — qualquer palavra nova seria semanticamente incluída em alente, assim pode ser refutado como sendo "alente, mas ainda mais nicho".
pt.definition: o conjunto de todos os conceitos humanos possíveis subtraídos do conjunto de conceitos já cobertos por palavras existentes em toki pona ponderadas pelo seu uso relativo

ro.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
ro.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

ru.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
ru.definition: множество всех возможных понятий минус множество понятий, уже покрытых существующими словами токи поны, взвешенных по их относительной популярности

sl.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
sl.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

sv.commentary: Myntades på skoj som "den sista nimisinen" - alla nya ord skulle redan semantiskt inkluderas i alente, så de kan nekas för att vara "alente, men mera nischade".
sv.definition: den uppsättning begrepp som uttrycks av etablerade toki pona-ord, subtraherad från uppsättningen av alla möjliga begrepp, så att varje begrepp som inte redan uttrycks av ett befintligt toki pona-ord uttrycks

th.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
th.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

tkl.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
tkl.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

tl_l.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
tl_l.definition: isang pangkat ng mga konsepto na inihahayag ng mga nakatalagang mga salita sa Toki Pona, binawasan sa pangkat ng bawat posibleng konsepto, upang maipahiwatig ang bawat konsepto na hindi pa napahiwatig ng anumang salitang mayroon sa Toki Pona

tok.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
tok.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

tr.commentary: "Son nimisin" olarak şaka niyetine türetilmişti - herhangi yeni bir kelime semantiken alente'de bulunacağı için "alente'nin daha özel bir hali" olarak reddedilebilirdi.
tr.definition: mümkün olan her kavramdan, toki pona ile ifade edebilen bütün kavramların çıkarılması ile oluşan küme içindeki her kavram için geçerli kelime

uk.commentary: Створене як жарт як «фінальний неологізм» — будь-яке інше слово буде семантично включене в alente, тож воно може бути заперечене через «це ж alente але трохи точніше».
uk.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

ur.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
ur.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

wuu.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
wuu.definition: the set of every possible human concept subtracted from the set of concepts already covered by established toki pona words weighted by their relative usage

yi.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
yi.definition: the set of concepts expressed by established toki pona words, subtracted from the set of every possible concept, such that every concept not already expressed by an existing toki pona word is expressed

yue.commentary: Coined humorously as the "final nimisin" - any newer word would semantically be included in alente, so it can be refuted for being "alente but even nicher".
yue.definition: 任何現有嘅 toki pona 字入面唔包含嘅任何概念

zh_hans.commentary: 声称为“最终的 nimisin（新词）”——任何之后创造的新词在词义上包含于 alente，所以它能以“和 alente 一样，但是范围更小”为由被拒绝。
zh_hans.definition: 所有可能的概念，减去既定道本语单词能表示的所有概念，使该词表示既有道本语单词都不能表示的所有概念

zh_hant.commentary: 聲稱為「最終的 nimisin（新詞）」——任何之後創造的新詞在詞義上包含於 alente，所以它能以「和 alente 一樣，但是範圍更小」為由被拒絕。
zh_hant.definition: 所有可能的概念，減去既定道本語單詞能表示的所有概念，使該詞表示既有道本語單詞都不能表示的所有概念

inisa.author_verbatim:
:nimisin: inisa
Interjection - used to get somebody to slow down and help you understand a concept
vocative - used to refer to somebody you forgot the name of
noun - forgetfulness, ignorance
verb - to forget
modifier - forgetful, ignorant
<- from Amharic "እንጃ" (ʾənəǧa /ʔɨ.nɨ.dʒä/)
creator: pan Waja

tok.definition: forget

ar.commentary: A particle that allows the speaker to specify the level of information they have about a situation. As a modifier, it means "at least" or "definitely", indicating knowledge of one thing but not necessarily other things.
ar.definition: at least, definitely; still, yet, even

ca.commentary: Una partícula que permet al parlant especificar el nivell d'informació que té sobre una situació. Com a modificador, vol dir "com a mínim" o "segur", indicant coneixement sobre una cosa però no necessàriament d'altres.
ca.definition: si més no, segur; encara, fins i tot

nl.commentary: Een deeltje dat de spreker in staat stelt om te specificeren welk niveau van informatie die over een situatie heeft. Als bijvoeglijk naamwoord of bijwoord betekent het "op z'n minst" of "sowieso", wat kennis van 1 ding weergeeft, maar niet noodzakelijkerwijs andere dingen.

zh_hans.commentary: 此助词能让说话者指定他对某个情况的熟悉程度。作为修饰词时，它的意思是“至少”或“肯定”，表示知悉一件事，但未必知道其他事情。
zh_hans.definition: 至少、起码、肯定；仍、还、甚至

zh_hant.commentary: 該助詞能讓說話者指定他對某個情況的熟悉程度。作為修飾詞時，它的意思是「至少」或「肯定」，表示知悉一件事，但未必知道其他事情。
zh_hant.definition: 至少、起碼、肯定；仍、還、甚至

ja.author_verbatim:
.. ja2 **ja** - *post-ku*: marks the end of a preverb (or preposition, with lu)

Makes it possible to make anything into a preverb without ambiguity.
> *mi tawa telo e kasi*: I'm moving a plant towards water.
> *mi tawa ja telo e kasi*: I'm going (in order) to water the plants.
Can be used to make composite preverbs by including multiple words before the ja.
> *mi wile mute ja sona e ni*: I really want to know this.
Can be stacked.
> *mi open ja olin ja telo e kasi*: I'm starting to love watering the plants.
Can optionally be used with existing preverbs to clarify them.
> *mi wile ja kama ja sona* = *mi wile kama sona.*
> *mi olin ja kama ja sona e ijo sin* = *mi olin ja kama sona e ijo sin* = I love to learn new things.
All preverbs before the last ja should be marked by ja.
> *mi wile ja tawa ja tawa musi* ≠ *mi wile tawa ja tawa musi.*

Can be used with lu (see `... lu`) to make composite prepositions.
> *soko li lu ante mute ja leko*: Mushrooms are very different to squares.
> *mi pali e ni lu kepeken wawa ja luka mi*: I made this by vigorously using my hands.
> *pakala ni li kama lon lu kepeken pi ike lili ja ilo kule*: This mess was made via somewhat bad usage of a paintbrush.
creator: wuwojiti Heav, jan Pensa, jan Kita

ar.commentary: Can also be combined with lo to mark modified or compound prepositions, marking the end of a preposition marked by lo and the start of the prepositional object.
ar.definition: (particle) [marks the previous word(s) as a single preverb]

nb.definition: en spesifikk gruppe tidlige medlemmer av Discord-gruppen ma pona

nl.commentary: Komt voort uit regelmatig gebruik tijdens de beginperiode van de ma pona pi toki pona Discord server. jans werd vaak gebruikt door de humor die voortkomt uit het toevoegen van een meervoudsachtervoegsel aan een Toki Pona-woord.

pa.definition: a particular group of early members of the ma pona pi toki pona Discord server

pl.commentary: Nie wymyślone bezpośrednio, lecz rozwinięte z wielokrotnego użycia przez wczesną społeczność serwera Discord ma pona pi toki pona. „jans” pojawiało się wielokrotnie ze względu na humor w dodaniu angielskiego przyrostka liczby mnogiej do słowa tokipońskiego.
pl.definition: konkretna grupa wczesnych członków Discorda ma pona

jume.author_verbatim: isipin is kinda dumb so here's a better nimisin: jume, dream

ar.commentary: Experimental, to see how the meaning could be expanded, but never actually used. No set of meanings was ever settled on before stopping the experiment, but one potential meaning the creator particularly liked was "fantasy" or "unreality", without a negative connotation.

zh_hans.commentary: 作者创造此单词是为了研究如何扩展它的词义，但从未实际使用。作者到停止实验前都没有采用任何一组词义，但特别喜欢“幻想”和“非现实”（不带贬义）这些意思。

zh_hant.commentary: 作者創造此單詞是為了研究如何擴展它的詞義，但從未實際使用。作者到停止實驗前都沒有採用任何一組詞義，但特別喜歡「幻想」和「非現實」（不帶貶義）這些意思。

jupi.author_verbatim:
[...] jupi - celebrate, celebration, victory, yippee (exclamation) <- Spanish "yupi"

also partially coined because there isn't a common toki pona word that starts with the syllable "ju" and i don't like any of the sandbox ones that do lol [...]
creator: jan Kita
niko
meli Siliwa

en.commentary: Coined indepentently multiple times over several years. Non-wuwojiti variant of the word jipi that has mostly overtaken it in use.
en.definition: yippee, woohoo (interjection indicating excitement, joy or happiness); to celebrate, to win; autism, autistic, ADHD, neurodivergent, spectrum, to stim
en.sp_etymology: wawa with emitters, the result of power or strength

ka.author_verbatim:
.. ka ka - ~toki sapin~ particle
    ← toki pona,  kama
It is the same as "li" but has the meaning of "tenpo kama" built into it.
So, "akesi ka moku" is the same as "tenpo kama la akesi li moku"
creator: jan Posuke

ka1.author_verbatim:
📣 ***ka*** *~nimisin~* — question marker
  ← Japanese か *ka* (question marker)
usage: `[sentence] ka` 
example: `sina pilin pona` (you feel good)
                  `sina pilin pona ka` (do you feel good?)
creator: qpaper

en.commentary:
Recoined indepentently multiple times over several years."
Originally created for toki sapin, a short-lived unfinished tokiponido created in January 2021 by jan Posuke. It survived through notes in ma pona pi toki pona, where it was the first thing that came up for "ka".
Created as part of a set with "so" for the past tense, "te" for the present tense, and contractions "miso", "mite", and "mika". Only "ka" has seen significant mention outside of toki sapin.
Borrowed from tuki tiki as a replacement for the deprecated konwe.
en.definition: living thing, moving being, creature; life, alive
en.sp_etymology: from tuki tiki's writing system (titi pula), borrowed along with the word. shows the face of a human or animal

tok.definition: the digit 9

es.definition: el sonido que hace un pirata

tok.definition: kalama pi jan ni: ona li lanpan ike e ijo tan jan ante. ona li kepeken tomo tawa. tomo tawa ni li lon telo. jan lawa li pilin ike tawa ona.

etymology.definition: 发声、作响；声音、噪音、人声
發聲、作響；聲音、噪音、人聲

ar.commentary: the orthography of that word is not fixed and any “wuwojiti” is not considered a mistake. In fact, basically anything after kalapis… can be altered and it would still be considered the same word (so go ahead and have fun with kalapisituwi, kalapisituje, kalapisu…, or any form that pleases you).
ar.definition: scam, utterly nonsensical, muddled and confused (often on purpose)

kepa.author_verbatim:
I have a few nimisin that I’ve been cooking on for the past month, so I’ll share a few over some time. this one is my best one so far in my opinion
:nimisin: ***kepa*** - etymology is a priori. pattern, order, series, sequence, to arrange, to organize. this overlaps with the semantic spaces of nasin and sike a bit. this word also can be used as an antonym of sorts to jaki and nasa. kepa as a content word is mostly useful when combined with other words. some examples would be "tenpo kepa" (rhythm), "kepa pi kasi kule" (bouquet/flower arrangement), "kepa pakala" (disarray, chaos). I also like to experiment with using it as a preposition that means something along the lines of "and then". some examples include "mi moku e kili li kepa tawa" (I ate fruit and then I walked), "mi en kepa sina li sitelen e nimi mi" (I will write my name and then you will write your name [nimi mi being used as "our names"]), and "jan lili li luka e soweli e kepa waso" (The child pet the animals and then the birds)
creator: kolisin

ar.commentary: Previously known as lu. Most of those interested in the word have agreed to change it to lo, to avoid interfering with the reserved word. Can also be combined with ja to mark modified or compound prepositions, with ja marking the end of a preposition marked by lo and the start of the prepositional object.

nl.commentary: Stond vroeger bekend als lu. De meeste van zei die geïnteresseer zijn in het woord zijn akkoord gegaan met het te herdopen tot lo, om niet in de weg van de gereserveerde woorden te komen. Kan ook met ja gecombineerd worden om het einde van een samengesteld voorzetsel aan te duiden, waarbij ja het einde van het voorzetsel aangeduid door lo aanduidt, en daarmee de start van het voorzettelijk object.

ar.commentary: this is a hard word to explain and you've got to use it right. It's pretty much linked to anything you could use "oh là  là" or "ouh là là" for. But because it's now a full-fledged toki pona content word, it got even more powerful and versatile. It can be used for joy, surprise, excitement, admiration, compassion, empathy, sadness, disappointment, and even to show you’re interested in someone romantically. However, it's equally important (or more) to know when to *not* use the word, you wouldn’t want to commit a faux-pas!

nl.commentary: dit is een moeilijk woord om uit te leggen, en het moet juist gebruikt worden. Het kan gebruikt worden op momenten waar je "o la la" of "oe la la" gebruikt worden. Maar gezien het nu een volwaardig toki pona woord is, wordt het nog veelzijdiger. Het kan gebruikt worden voor vreugde, verrassing, opwinding, bewondering, medeleven, empathie, verdriet, teleurstelling en zelfs om te tonen dat je romantisch geïnteresseerd bent in iemand. Maar het is even belangerijk (of zelfs belangerlijker) om te weten wanneer het woord níét gebruikt hoort te worden. Niemand wil graag een faux-pas maken!

onono.author_verbatim:
alright everone, i've come to nimisin. except it's not just any nimisin, it's one that i've put a bit of work into and have grown very fond of.

nimi: onono
meaning: emergency, attention, urgent; primarily an interjection
sitelen: triangle with exclamation point

while one could use it as a content word, the main purpose of onono is as an interjection at the beginning of a sentence, especially to call attention and convey a sense of urgency. in a way, it's a "set the context" nimi more than a "has a meaning" nimi. ideally, this nimi is useful as rarely as possible. but like a fire extinguisher, you would have it in case you need it, not because you use it often enough.

there are certainly plenty other ways that you could describe an onono situation without onono, but that's not the point. the point of the nimi is that having a single word that is immediately recognizable is extra beneficial in that particular situation, especially with how context would be as against you as it gets in that moment.

i've already been using onono in my works the past several months (albeit not many times due to its nature) and i really like it so far. it just feels to me that "emergency" is one of the most important things to be able to communicate, so it would make sense to have a dedicated word for that purpose, no matter how narrow that purpose is.

and of course, obviously don't use conlangs in an actual emergency. though if you were in a tpt environment, onono can also convey "what i'm about to say is probably really important so don't jump to kokosila'ing me if i start using a different language."

(if i don't respond it's because i used up all my spoons battling my "presenting creation" anxiety and "public discord" anxiety)
creator: ko Luna

it.definition: richiamare l'attenzione a qualcosa di urgente

tok.definition: calling attention to urgency

ar.commentary: Several (different?) people in 2019-2021 weirdly kept putting "papa" in their Reddit / Facebook posts, seemingly to promote it as a word to other people. It caused a backlash, with other people criticising the coinage, and coining other meanings for "papa".

salu.author_verbatim:
#1725441 📣 salu – ~post-ku~ comfort, security, safety, stability; attention, care, caution
   ← Latin salus 'safety, security'
creator: rose

ar.commentary: 💭 Intended as an experiment in its current form, and is not meant for widespread use at this time. Meant to be used alongside a nasin that does not use either ike or pona to express value judgements (especially morality). These words are often used in a way that ignores the reasoning behind the judgement. The goal of this experimental nasin is to promote mindfulness about value itself, translating mere reaction into introspection and explanation. ⚠️ Because of the stated attachment to this particular nasin pi toki pona, it should be noted that using salu and pona/ike as good/bad at the same time goes against the point of the word's creation, and that salu is redundant in this circumstance. If you are using one, you should not use the other.
ar.definition: comfort, security, safety, stability; attention, care, caution

nl.commentary: 💭 Bedoeld als een experiment in zijn huidige vorm, en niet bedoeld voor wijdverspreid gebruik op dit moment. Bedoeld om naast een nasin waarbij ike noch pona gebruikt worden wanneer het gaat over waardeoordelen (vooral in zake moraliteit). ike en pona worden vaak zomaar gebruikt zonder de redenering achter het waardeoordeel. Het doel van deze experimentele nasin is om de mindfullness van de waarde zelf te promoten, in plaats van steeds een oordeel te moeten vellen. ⚠️ Vanwege de verklaarde gehechtheid aan deze nasin pi toki pona, moet gezegd worden dat salu en pona of ike tegelijk gebruiken, tegen de ontstaansreden van dit woord in gaat, en salu overbodig is in die situatie. Als je er een gebruikt, hoor je de andere niet te gebuiken.
nl.definition: confort, veiligheid, stabiliteit; aandacht, zorg, voorzichtigheid

sipi.author_verbatim: I thought of another word which would mean the "ego", "self", "own",because Toki Pona doesn't have reflexive voice and pronoun like inthe sentences "he's watching himself (and not somebody else)" or "Hetake his own(not her) hand". I called it "sipi" (as it is "sibi" inLatin). Then it would be "ona li lukin e sipi (pi ona)" (he watcheshis ego) and "ona li jo e luka sipi (pi ona)" (he takes his ego'shand). It would also be used to compound words like "egoism"(nasin/pilin sipi) and so on...What do you think?
creator: spad0103

siwala.author_verbatim:
**siwala** ★ the quality of being outside of understanding but accepted as reality; the quality of being not wished to be understood by one for the benefits associated with not understanding
    ← Tagalog tiwalà 'trust; faith (in someone or something); reliance, confidence, belief'
creator: ilo Powa

sunta.author_verbatim:
<:nimisin:743741432350769152> **sunta** — tritanopic color grouping, roughly seen as reds, pinks, and magentas, and roughly covers the perception of the wide range from warm violet, red, orange, and yellow
<- toki pona *suno* + *uta*
creator: kolisin

en.commentary: Part of a system with kewe to express the colors seen by someone with tritanopia (blue-yellow colorblindness).

etymology.definition: light, shine, glow, radiance; sun, light source; brightness

tok.definition: cute animal

ar.commentary: Follows a semantically consistent pattern of "SUBJ li PV ta PRED" = "SUBJ li PV e [SUBJ li PRED]" or "[SUBJ li PRED] li PV". The top and bottom lines of the sitelen pona may be extended to the left around the pre-predicate word(s).

tasun.author_verbatim: :nimisin: ***t(a+)sun*** – dachshund; amount of `a` varies depending on physical length
creator: jan Pensa, jan Kita

ar.sp_etymology: pictogram of a dachshund, stretched according to the amount of the letter a

uka.author_verbatim: I've actually kinda thought about the concept of a conlanguage that specifically encodes the deuteranopia color spectrum as default & so i like this idea
creator: soweli kina

en.commentary: Part of a system with kelo to express the colors seen by someone with protanopia or deuteranopia (red-green colorblindness).
en.sp_etymology: kule with emitters, with the line replaced with a dot to distinguish from tona

umesu.author_verbatim: to amaze people by being on top of the musi Ako leaderboard
creator: jan Wija

ar.commentary: Created for the game Acrophobia (musi Ako) in response to the fact that there are few words starting with 'u' in Toki Pona.
ar.definition: amaze people by being on the top of the leaderboard of a toki pona game

wawajete.author_verbatim:
•Something that appears to break the rules but doesn't
•Faux edginess
•Provocation
creator: jan Tolin

ar.commentary: Coined in reference to wuwojiti, a sequence of all phonotactically unviable CV syllables in toki pona.
ar.definition: something that appears to break the rules but doesn't; faux edginess, provocation

etymology.definition: (all the phonotactically unviable CV syllables in Toki Pona)

ca.commentary: Coined in reference to wuwojiti, a sequence of all phonotactically unviable CV syllables in toki pona.
ca.definition: quelcom que sembla que trenca les normes però no ho fa; falsa altivesa, provocació

cs.definition: něco, co na první pohled porušuje pravidla, ale ve skutečnosti tomu tak není; provokace

etymology.definition: (všechny fonotakticky nemožné CV slabiky v Toki Pona)
